title: Domain 2.10: Given a scenario, configure appropriate security settings on small office/home SOHO wireless and wired networks.
content:
🌐 Browser Download/Installation

  • ✅ Trusted Sources: Always download browsers like Chrome or Firefox from official websites or reputable app stores to avoid tampered versions.
  • 🔐 Hashing: Use hash values (e.g., SHA-256) to confirm a file's integrity and ensure it hasn't been altered during download.
  • 🚫 Untrusted Sources: Avoid using torrents or random links for browser installs—common sources of malware.

🧩 Extensions and Plug-ins

  • 🔒 Trusted Sources: Use only the official browser extension stores and review permissions before installing.
  • ⚠️ Untrusted Sources: Avoid extensions from unknown websites or developers—they may contain spyware or adware.

🔑 Password Managers

  • Securely store, generate, and autofill complex passwords.
  • Browser-based managers are convenient; third-party ones offer more robust features and encryption.

🔐 Secure Connections/Sites – Valid Certificates

  • Look for HTTPS and the padlock icon before submitting sensitive data.
  • Certificates confirm you're connecting to the real site—not a spoofed version.

⚙️ Browser Settings

  • 🚫 Pop-up Blocker: Blocks annoying or dangerous pop-ups. Adjustable by site.
  • 🧹 Clearing Browsing Data / Cache: Helps protect privacy and fix performance issues.
  • 🕵️ Private-Browsing Mode: No history, cookies, or cache stored—useful for private sessions.
  • 🔄 Sign-in / Browser Data Sync: Syncs bookmarks, passwords, and history—secure with MFA!
  • 🛑 Ad Blockers: Blocks intrusive ads, helps prevent malicious downloads, and speeds up browsing.
